content.question: A slope field for the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y with respect to x, equals x plus y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> is shown. The point <math alttext="with coordinates 2 comma negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> is indicated in the figure. Let <math alttext="y equals, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> be the solution to the differential equation with initial condition <math alttext="f of 2, equals negative 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></math>. If <math alttext="f of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is approximated by using Euler's method with two steps of equal size starting at <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math>, which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="f of 3, is approximately equal to one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≈</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>, and this value is an underapproximation of <math alttext="f of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>.

<math alttext="f of 3, is approximately equal to one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≈</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>, and this value is an overapproximation of <math alttext="f of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>.

<math alttext="f of 3, is approximately equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≈</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>, and this value is an underapproximation of <math alttext="f of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>.

<math alttext="f of 3, is approximately equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≈</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>, and this value is an overapproximation of <math alttext="f of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="f of 3, is approximately equal to one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≈</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>, and this value is an underapproximation of <math alttext="f of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>.

topic.text: 7.5: (BC ONLY) Approximating Solutions Using Euler's Method

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
